Join us for an immersive and educational photography workshop that will take you on a journey of discovery and transformation. Our Devon Photography Workshops are designed to empower you, unlock your creative potential, and help you master the art of seascape photography. Why Choose Devon for Landscape Photography? Devon is renowned for its stunning natural beauty, diverse landscapes, and captivating coastlines. Devon offers many breathtaking locations for photography enthusiasts, from dramatic cliffs and rocky shorelines to pristine sandy beaches. The region's unique combination of rock formations, tides, and ever-changing weather conditions create the perfect setting for capturing mesmerizing seascapes. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced photographer, Devon provides endless opportunities to hone your skills and create stunning works of art. Workshop Itinerary Our 3 or 4-day workshops take you on a journey through some of the most breathtaking coastal locations in North Devon. Each day is carefully planned to maximize your learning and capture the region's beauty. Here's a glimpse into what you can expect: Day 1: Arrival and Introduction Meet at the specified location and time, where our expert photography instructor will greet you. Get acquainted with fellow workshop participants and enjoy a workshop introduction and briefing. Embark on your first location shoot at Hartland Quay, one of the UK's most dramatic seascape locations. After a productive day of shooting, check in at the designated Hotel/B&B. Optional sunset shoot, depending on light/time of year/forecast. Wrap up the day with an evening meal and optional picture reviews. Day 2 & 3: Capturing the Beauty of Devon Start the day with a possible sunrise shoot, taking advantage of the magical early morning light. Enjoy a hearty breakfast before heading out for another location shoot. Take a break for lunch to refuel and recharge. Continue your exploration of Devon's coastal wonders with additional location shoots. Engage in photo reviews and editing sessions, where you'll receive valuable feedback and learn post-processing techniques. Optional sunset shoots, capturing the golden hour and the mesmerising beauty of the coastline. Conclude each day with an evening meal, where you can engage in optional picture reviews and further discussions with fellow participants. Final Day: Departure Start the day with a possible sunrise shoot, making the most of your last opportunity to capture the stunning coastal landscapes. Enjoy a delicious breakfast and prepare for your final location shoot. After a productive morning, take a break for lunch to reflect on your journey and the skills you've acquired. Bid farewell to your fellow workshop participants and depart with a newfound appreciation for seascape photography and the beauty of Devon. Workshop Locations North Devon is a treasure trove of stunning locations that cater to every photographer's vision and preferences. Here are just a few examples of the breathtaking locations we may visit during our workshop: Hartland Quay - Our base and one of the UK's most dramatic seascape locations, featuring long slithers of rock formations and a fierce tide. Bude - A charming coastal town known for its picturesque beaches and stunning cliffs. Clovelly - A favourite spot for lunch, with its beautiful harbour and unique charm. Sandymouth - A sandy beach with rock formations blending natural beauty and rugged landscapes. Croyde - A popular surfing destination with sandy beaches and rolling waves. Welcombe Bay - A hidden gem known for its tranquil beauty and stunning rock formations. Saunton Sands - A vast sandy beach that stretches for miles, offering endless opportunities for photography. Coombesgate - A secluded cove with dramatic cliffs and breathtaking views. Woolacombe - An award-winning sandy beach with rolling dunes and crystal-clear waters. Westward Ho - A unique coastal village is known for its expansive sandy beach and stunning sunsets. Please note that the final itinerary will be provided 5-7 days before the workshop, considering weather, tide times, and any other local seasonal factors. We aim to ensure that you have the best possible experience and capture the beauty of Devon's coastal landscapes. Who Should Attend? Our Devon Photography Workshops are suitable for photographers of all skill levels. Whether you're a beginner looking to learn the basics or an experienced photographer aiming to refine your technique, our workshops offer something for everyone. Our expert instructors will tailor their guidance to meet your individual needs and help you unlock your creative potential. We believe everyone has a unique perspective to bring to the world of photography, and our workshops are designed to nurture and enhance your skills, regardless of your starting point. What to Bring? To make the most of your photography workshop experience, we recommend bringing the following equipment: Camera: A DSLR or mirrorless camera will provide the best results, but any camera with manual settings will suffice. Lenses: Wide-angle lenses are ideal for capturing expansive seascapes, but various lenses can be helpful in different perspectives. Tripod: A sturdy tripod is essential for long exposures and ensuring sharp images. Filters: Neutral density, graduated, and polarizing filters can enhance your images and help you achieve the desired effect. Remote Shutter Release: This will eliminate camera shake when shooting long exposures. Spare Batteries and Memory Cards: It's always a good idea to have backups to avoid missing out on capturing those special moments. Comfortable Clothing and Footwear: Be prepared for changing weather conditions and rugged terrains. Laptop and Editing Software: Bring your laptop and preferred editing software if you wish to participate in the photo review and editing sessions. Please note that this list is not exhaustive, and our instructors will provide further guidance on equipment and accessories before the workshop. Workshop Details And Logistics Instructor: I have photographed and run workshops here for over ten years so can guide you throughout the workshop, providing expert advice and feedback. Accommodation: Rest and recharge in a comfortable hotel accommodation on the edge of Hartland Quay Bay Meals: Enjoy delicious meals at the hotel, allowing you to connect with fellow participants and share your photography experiences without further travel. Optional Picture Reviews: Receive personalised feedback and tips on your images during optional picture review sessions. Transportation: Transportation to and from the workshop locations will be provided, ensuring convenience and ease of access depending on the itinerary for day one and the last day. Equipment: Bring your camera equipment, including a DSLR or mirrorless camera, a range of lenses, tripods, filters, and any other accessories you prefer but we can advise and loan some equipment if required. Fitness Level: A moderate fitness level is required, as some locations may involve short walks or hikes and slippery/hazardous shoreline conditions. Workshop Size: To ensure individual attention and a personalised learning experience, our workshops are limited to a small (4) group of participants.
